GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1991 as a branch of the Azerbaijan State Oil and Industry University, and in 1992 became independent as a Mingachevir Energy Institute, in 1993 renamed as a Mingachevir Polytechnic University. In 2015, it was reorganized as a Mingachevir State University
Founded 1991. Was also known as Western University
AdmissionRequirements: Competitive entrance examination following general or special secondary school certificate (Attestat)

Address.college_name: Academy of State Customs Committee of Republic of Azerbaijan
Address.university_name: Azərbaycan Respublikası Dövlət Gömrük Komitəsinin Akademiyası – Azerbaijan Customs Academy / Azərbaycan Gömrük Akademiyası (ASCCA / DGKA)

GeneralInformation.History: Createdin 2012 by Decree of the President of the Republic of Azerbaijan and started to function in 2014, with the first students graduating in 2017/2018. ASCCA (or Azerbaijan Customs Academy, ACA) is an education, training and research institution under the State Customs Committee (SCC) of the Republic of Azerbaijan. As a special purpose, public higher education institution accredited in the country, the Academy carries out higher education programs (BA and MA levels in economics, customs studies, legal studies and international law and information security), as well as the customs officers advanced training and continuous/lifelong learning programs, and aims to conduct scientific, fundamental and applied research primarily related to the Academy's activity areas as well as on the national, regional and international customs affairs.In line with its Statute and the indicated Decree, the Academy is authorized to conduct its international cooperation independently. International cooperation is one of the most important priorities for the ASCCA, which establishes mutually beneficial relations with the most relevant higher education institutions and particularly, with the (inter-) national customs (and customs-related) training institutes, across the continents

Address.university_name: ADA Universiteti – ADA University under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Azerbaijan

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2006 by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Azerbaijan as the Azerbaijan Diplomatic Academy with the main objective of training specialists for a diplomatic career in Azerbaijani foreign affairs. Programmes were expanded and the name changed to ADA University in 2014

Divisions.Details: Operates as a general education facility.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1930. Azerbaijan State University of Economics is one of the largest higher education institutions in the Southern Caucasus. There are 11 faculties operating at UNEC with more than 18000 students studying 21 specialities. More than one thousand teachers, as well as 77 professors and 326 assistant professors among whom figure members of the National Academy of Sciences
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Attestat); SSAC (State Student Admission Commission) test results

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1920 following the closure of Baku Polytechnic technical school and was named Baku Polytechnic Institute, focusing on training engineers in sectors such as agriculture, civil engineering, electromechanics, economics, and oil. In 1923, was renamed Azerbaijan Polytechnic Institute. In 1929 the school was divided into three independent schools covering agriculture, economy, and oil and in 1934 became Azerbaijan Industrial Institute. In 1950 the government reorganized the Institute, establishing Azerbaijan Polytechnic Institute (AzPI) and in 1953 it acquired university status and was renamed Azerbaijan Technical University
Created 2006 as Azerbaijan Institute of Tourism. Acquired current title and status 2014
Founded 1991, acquired present status 1995
AdmissionRequirements: Competitive entrance examination following general or secondary school certificate (Attestat)

Address.college_name: Azerbaijan University of Architecture and Construction

GeneralInformation.History: Created in 1920 as a higher education institution focusing on construction and architecture and departments were functioning in various higher educational institutions of Azerbaijan. In 1975 the Azerbaijan Engineering and Construction Institute was establised as an independent institution on the initiative of Heydar Aliyev on the Decision of Ministerial Council of the Azerbaijan Republic. It acquired its current title in 2000
Founded 1937 as Azerbaijan State Institute of Foreign Languages, acquired present status and title 2000
Founded in 1970 as the Kirovabad branch of the Azerbaijan Polytechnic Institute, became Azerbaijan Technological Institute in 1980 and acquired present title and status in 2000
